summary: The Bank Privacy Reform Act (H.R. 533) aims to amend the Right to Financial Privacy Act of 1978 and Title 31 of the United States Code, focusing on bank secrecy and financial record access. The bill modifies regulations related to government access to financial records, transaction reporting, and penalties for violations. It seeks to limit government oversight of financial institutions and customer data, while still mandating record retention. Several sections pertaining to financial crime enforcement are also struck from the legislation.
